definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: Store perishable food in refrigerator. Keep it well covered.
sentences.chinese: 容易變壞的食物應蓋好存放於雪櫃中。

sentences.english: Six-character numeric passwords are dismayingly common, and the examples only go downhill from there.
sentences.chinese: 六位數字密碼是令人驚愕地相同，並且該例只會變壞。

sentences.english: Would it be better or worse?
Their marriage turned sour due to his infidelities.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他的不忠實，使得他們的婚姻關係變壞。

sentences.english: But by late afternoon, tempers clearly frayed.
sentences.chinese: 但是到了傍晚，人們的脾氣顯然變壞了。

sentences.english: Asphaltene content increased, the deterioration of oil quality.
sentences.chinese: 瀝青質含量增高時，原油質量變壞。

sentences.english: If or else is in charge of him, of this child's true can complete addle.
sentences.chinese: 假如再不管他，這孩子真的會徹底變壞的。

sentences.english: People are always worried that mayonnaise will spoil.
sentences.chinese: 人們經常擔心沙拉油會變壞。

sentences.english: Water quality can deteriorate in the summer.
Jim allowed they'd got spoiled and was hove out of the nest.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆認爲它們是變壞了，所以才被趕出了自己的窩。

sentences.english: Drinking too much alcoholic liquor often depraves a person's character.
sentences.chinese: 過度飲用烈酒常會使人的性格變壞。

sentences.english: We all know nice girls finish last.
sentences.chinese: 我們都知道所謂淑女總要變壞的。

sentences.english: I fear for the safety of those mountain-climbers in this sudden bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 天氣突然變壞，我真替登山運動員擔心。

sentences.english: The worst that you can imagine happening is it going stale.
sentences.chinese: 你能想到的最壞的事情只不過是它會變壞了。

sentences.english: Milk can easily go bad in summer.
Never leave perishable food out of the refrigerator for more than two hours;
sentences.chinese: 絕不要把能變壞的食品在冰箱外放超過兩小時。

definition: to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to come to sb's door/to call on sb
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
